summary: The SDK cannot currently use pure ESM npm modules like node-fetch@3 due to hardcoded CommonJS Webpack configuration. As the Node ecosystem increasingly adopts ESM, this limitation will become a growing problem requiring a bundling solution that supports both ESM and CommonJS.
userImpact: Users are unable to use pure ESM npm modules in their Temporal applications and must downgrade to older CommonJS versions.
rootCause: Webpack configuration is hardcoded to CommonJS, preventing import of pure ESM modules.
proposedFix: Implement a smooth bundling solution that supports both ESM and CommonJS modules.
workaround: Downgrade to older CommonJS versions of packages (e.g., node-fetch@2 instead of @3).
resolutionDetails: A sample ESM solution was created and subsequently implemented in a subsequent release.
keyQuote: over time, this will increasingly be a problem, as more and more of the Node ecosystem goes pure ESM
